title: Suspended?
body:
So, I was recently given a chat restriction for things i've said in game. First thing i'll say that I don't understand is, why do you put a chat filter in a game, AND give the function to MUTE people so you don't deal with their negative attitude, if you're also going to suspend their accounts? If someones negative because they've had a bad game, then so be it. Who cares. Mute them and move on. We all have bad games. What do you want us to do, play the game and not vent? We play video games to relieve stress. That aside, I understand the times I received a chat restriction. However, this is completely unacceptable. I think from going to cursing every sentence to what i'm about to post, should be a huge turn around. But I receive a suspension for this? I don't think that's right and I would like to know how it is right. 

The community, as in the players in that game, just didn't like me, because I was pointing out things that people were doing wrong, and they report me for verbal abuse. I didn't curse once in that game, nor did I negatively harass anyone. I tried to keep composure as best I can, and I believe from cursing consistently to this, I think it should be praised that I'm doing better. But instead I'm banned. And i'm banned just because I get reported by people? People report people every game. If someone on the team becomes the blame, everyone reports them just to make themselves feel better. Did anyone even read these chat logs to see that I didn't even flame or be "toxic"?

RoninStarr,

You have received a 14 day ban following an extensive audit of in-game behavior within recent League of Legends matches.

Your peers judged your behavior to be far below the standards of the League of Legends community. Think through the conversation and reflect on your words. League is an intense, competitive game, but every player deserves respect. Read more about the effort to encourage sportsmanlike play, here.

Here are some chat logs that were identified as negative by other players in the community.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
it was my own fault, I keep going too hard
bad has more dmg than I expect
when we're lvl 6 I swear they're so done
they're constantly pushed bot
not sure why hec doesn't come or hasn't yet

appreciate all the help you guys give us
not flaming
just pointing out the obvious
oh look more ganks to lanes and our jungler isn't there
nor mid
awesome
playing safe doesn't matter at this point, all lanes lost and we don't have a jungler
lmao hec still farming jungle while we're fighting mid and we're losing towers bot
like I said, we don't have a jungle
Hecarim, you have a map, it shows you where people are. You're on a team, not solo game. Help your team.
There are objectives, defend your teams, and attack their teams.
you were farming jungle
lmao, how does this happen
jungler says he helped mid by ganking 5 times
yet our mid still lost
hahhaa gg
lol how does a lane lose when they get 5 ganks
and if you gank the same lane 5 times and don't help the other lanes, how does that help the team
nami how come you always save your ult?
you just had 4 people right in front of you
we had them under tower
and you don't ult
gg
you have always only ult'd 1 person
nah i'm good
games over
we stood no chance with this mid and jungle and top
it's been over for awhile
gg
gg
lux gj winning against our mid despite he got 5 ganks and still lost
glad our jungle focused only your lane

replies.body: You can read what I was banned for, tell me if you think someone should be banned for that. We had a jungler that went mid 5 times, and didn't go top or bottom. He even said so in game. Top lost, bottom lost, and the mid was constantly roaming to bottom lane to gank. Our mid never left lane, but also got 5 ganks and still lost lane. But I get banned for pointing it out and saying they need to help?

If you are looking for feedback from the community about the chat you should include all 3 games that were given on your reform card.

Also, please keep in mind that your 3 previous punishments you obtained in a single month are also taken into account for escalation.

atleast it isnt a rohjin {{summoner:11}} {{summoner:11}} {{summoner:11}} {{summoner:11}}  he would have posted all the chat logs and publicly announced on the boards the suspension, as a way to embarrass him.

I think you should be suspended for this, yeah. It's not what you say, it's how you say it. If you complain all game and have an overall negative attitude, people pick up on that stuff and it will lead to a negative environment. 

Truth is, you aren't going to be ganked all game every game, by your teammates or your enemies. If your jungler doesn't gank for you, then you need to play with that condition in mind, not complain to your team about not getting a gank. Chances are he made a tactical decision and found that ganking bottom wouldn't be worth as much.

Speaking as a jungle main, the quickest way to never get a gank from me is to complain about my "absence" in the game. Stuff like "we don't have a jungler lol" or "you have a map, it shows you where people are" are super sarcastic and just downright rude. There's no reason to behave like this. If one of my teammates starts talking like this, it makes me much less likely to want to help them.

Be kind to your teammates. It goes a long way.

i hate to be "THAT GUY" but to avoid a ban because of it, you have to play nicer. no offense to anyone who plays the game, but people who play it tend to act like little kids when someone points out a flaw in their game. try a nicer approach next time, ask nicely, and when you get flamed for it, report them and send the chat logs.

I want you to understand, otherwise you cannot grow as a person. why did you get banned? what did you say to make them want to report you? consider these things more than you ever have, empathize with their decision, you dont need to be the bad guy in these situations, you can modify your behavior more than anybody can tell you too, because its up to you to change

lol, wow, this was a toxic overload of misunderstanding and a wrong mindset. Because you don't curse or say something blatantly offensive, doesn't mean others wont consider it in a 1,000,000 different ways than you did. this entire chat, you criticized like a grammar Nazi and created an overall unpleasant environment for those involved, if you need to vent, don't to it at the people in a match, you created the issue yourself. and here we are. re-evaluate yourself, how to choose to talk to others, how you choose to respond to situations, and to take things much, much easier than you have shown to. Maybe by being the bigger person and not added to the toxicity, then you wont be where you are now. :) im being honest. the way you choose to behave is yours alone, you got suspended, view things from their perspective and you might see why you were suspended and grow as a person in the future

What am I supposed to do in a game where our jungler literally only goes mid 5 times, and their mid comes bot and ganks while our mid never leaves lane? Should I just not say anything and try as hard as I can for nothing since people don't do their jobs properly? They don't call mia's, they don't help other lanes, but they only help each other and then report me because I ask for help. Yes I was sarcastic, but at the same time, they were the ones not helping the other teammates out. But they needed someone to blame for the loss so they choose me just because I talk

Lol is not a chat room.
The point of the game is to play the game.

Talking in chat is meant to further that end.
Encouraging others to that end, or communicating necessary information.
Its ok to chat if you are doing either of these things, but if your team is not receptive to your communications **then stop communicating**.


And some clarification on the punishment system:

> The severity of the punishment is not based on severity of offense. It is a 4 strike system, where severity of the punishment is based on how many strikes you have accrued:
> 
> 1st strike - 10 game chat ban
> 2nd strike - 25 game chat ban
> 3rd strike - 14 day full ban
> 4th strike - perma
>
> There is an exception for hate speech, racial slurs, or extreme cases of toxicity, that will result in skipping and going straight to 3rd or 4th strike.

If you've been punished before, and the last punishment was your 2nd strike, then 14 day ban will result regardless of the offense.

Basically you are not being punished for individual cases of toxicity. Rather you are being punished for **continued** cases of toxicity after having been **told to stop 3 times**.

A bit of warning.
The transition from 14 day to perma is more sensitive than the other strikes, because at this point your history has shown no signs of remorse or reform. If you want to keep your account, you need to kill all toxicity from your matches for at least 3 months.
(it takes 3 months to clear one strike, so 9 months total to fully clear your account)

It's not what you say, its how you say it. acting offending by their decisions isnt going to make them want to involve themselves with you any more than before, be nice! light hearted! joke and enjoy the game for the game that it is. People arent perfect, things happen, things you disagree with, things you agree with, its your decision to choose how you approach it, friendly and entertaining for the entire group, or stressful and tension filled for all involved. "Manners maketh Man"

The lesson here, is never type in any game or risk a ban. Period.  Remember, the truth is toxic.

I had a 10 game then 25 game, then went roughly a month without getting reported, but i just had a 10 and 25 game stack up on me.  Im trying to remember not to type anything at all, but its hard.
